canonical_explanation.text: Thrust is the force acting perpendicular to a surface. Pressure is defined as the thrust (force) per unit area. The formula is Pressure = Force / Area. The SI unit is Pascal (Pa), where 1 Pa = 1 N/m². Pressure in liquids increases with depth and is given by P = ρgh, where ρ is density, g is acceleration due to gravity, and h is depth. Pascal's law states that pressure applied to a confined fluid is transmitted equally in all directions. Atmospheric pressure is the pressure exerted by the air around us, measured using a barometer.
rules: Thrust is force acting perpendicular to a surface.
SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa) = N/m²
Smaller area means greater pressure for the same force.
Liquid pressure increases with depth: P = ρgh
Pascal's law: Pressure is transmitted equally in all directions in a fluid.
Hydraulic machines work on Pascal's law.
Atmospheric pressure is about 101,325 Pa (1 atm).

questions.question_text: What is thrust?
questions.explanation_correct: Thrust is the force acting perpendicular to a surface, so option B is the correct answer. Thrust is the force that is applied at right angles to the surface, not parallel to it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Thrust is not a force parallel to a surface (option A). It is also not the mass (option C) or volume (option D) of an object. Thrust is the force acting perpendicular to a surface, meaning it is applied at right angles to the surface.

questions.question_text: What is the formula for pressure?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct formula for pressure is Pressure = Force / Area. This makes sense because pressure is the force acting on a surface divided by the area of that surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct formula for pressure is Pressure = Force / Area. This is because pressure is a measure of the force acting on a surface divided by the area of that surface. The other options, such as Pressure = Force × Area or Pressure = Area / Force, do not accurately represent the relationship between pressure, force, and area.

questions.question_text: What is the SI unit of pressure?
questions.explanation_correct: The SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa). Pressure is defined as the force (thrust) acting on a surface divided by the area of the surface. The formula for pressure is P = F/A, and the SI unit for pressure is the pascal, where 1 pascal = 1 newton per square meter (1 Pa = 1 N/m²).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct SI unit of pressure. Newton is the SI unit of force, not pressure. Joule is the SI unit of energy, and watt is the SI unit of power. The correct SI unit of pressure is the pascal (Pa), which is defined as the force (in newtons) acting on a surface divided by the area (in square meters) of that surface.

questions.question_text: As you go deeper in water, the pressure:
questions.explanation_correct: As you go deeper in water, the pressure increases because there is more water pressing down on you. This is due to the force of gravity acting on the water above, which creates more pressure at greater depths.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure does not decrease or remain the same as you go deeper in water. This is because the weight of the water above you creates more force (pressure) as you go deeper. The pressure increases with depth, as given by the formula P = ρgh, where ρ is the density of the water, g is the acceleration due to gravity, and h is the depth.

questions.question_text: Which instrument is used to measure atmospheric pressure?
questions.explanation_correct: A barometer is the instrument used to measure atmospheric pressure. This is because atmospheric pressure is the pressure exerted by the air around us, and a barometer is designed specifically to measure this type of pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A thermometer is used to measure temperature, not atmospheric pressure. An ammeter measures electric current, and a voltmeter measures electric potential difference. None of these instruments are used to measure atmospheric pressure, which is the force exerted by the air around us. The correct instrument to measure atmospheric pressure is a barometer.

questions.question_text: Why do sharp knives cut better than blunt ones?

options.text: They have smaller area, creating more pressure
They are made of better material

questions.explanation_correct: Sharp knives have a smaller surface area compared to blunt knives, which means the same amount of force is applied to a smaller area. This creates higher pressure, allowing the knife to cut through materials more easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Knives that are heavier or made of better material do not necessarily cut better than sharp knives. The reason sharp knives cut better is that they have a smaller surface area, which creates higher pressure when the same force is applied. This higher pressure allows the knife to slice through materials more effectively.

questions.question_text: Why do dams have thicker walls at the bottom than at the top?

options.text: To withstand greater water pressure at the bottom

questions.explanation_correct: The walls of a dam are thicker at the bottom because the water pressure increases with depth. The deeper the water, the greater the pressure on the dam. Thicker walls at the bottom are needed to withstand this greater water pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dams do not have thicker walls at the bottom just to use more material or for decoration. The correct reason is that the water pressure increases with depth, and the thicker walls at the bottom are needed to withstand this greater pressure. The walls are not thicker to prevent earthquakes.

questions.question_text: A force of 100 N is applied on an area of 2 m². What is the pressure?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 50 Pa. This is because the formula for pressure is P = F/A, where P is the pressure, F is the force, and A is the area. Plugging in the given values, we get P = 100 N / 2 m² = 50 Pa.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not correctly apply the formula for pressure. Option A) 200 Pa is incorrect because it would mean the force is 200 N, not 100 N. Option C) 100 Pa is incorrect because it does not take the area into account. Option D) 0.02 Pa is incorrect because it is much too small and does not match the given force and area.

questions.question_text: According to Pascal's law, pressure applied to a confined fluid:

options.text: Is transmitted equally in all directions

questions.explanation_correct: According to Pascal's law, when pressure is applied to a confined fluid, it is transmitted equally in all directions throughout the fluid. This means the pressure is not absorbed or decreased, but rather spreads out evenly in all directions within the fluid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is that pressure applied to a confined fluid is transmitted equally in all directions, not just downward. This is because the fluid exerts an equal force in all directions, allowing the pressure to spread out uniformly. It is not absorbed by the fluid, nor does it decrease with distance from the applied force.

questions.question_text: A drinking straw works because of:
questions.explanation_correct: A drinking straw works because of atmospheric pressure. When you suck air out of the straw, it creates a low-pressure region inside the straw. The higher atmospheric pressure outside the straw then pushes the liquid up into the straw, allowing you to drink it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The drinking straw does not work due to gravitational force, magnetic force, or electric force. These forces do not play a significant role in how a straw functions. The straw works because of the difference in atmospheric pressure between the inside and outside of the straw, as explained in the correct explanation.

questions.question_text: Pressure increases when the area of contact increases for the same force.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is false. When the area of contact increases for the same force, the pressure actually decreases. This is because pressure is defined as force divided by area. If the force remains the same but the area increases, the pressure will become lower.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is incorrect. Pressure is defined as the force acting on a surface divided by the area of that surface. If the force remains the same but the area increases, the pressure will actually decrease. This is because the same force is now being spread over a larger area, resulting in a lower pressure. Increasing the area of contact does not increase the pressure.

questions.question_text: Liquid pressure at a given depth depends on the density of the liquid.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the pressure in a liquid at a given depth depends on the density of the liquid. The formula for pressure in liquids is P = ρgh, where ρ is the density of the liquid. This means that liquids with higher density will have higher pressure at the same depth compared to liquids with lower density.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. The pressure in a liquid at a given depth depends on the density of the liquid. This is because the formula for pressure in liquids is P = ρgh, where ρ is the density of the liquid. If the density of the liquid is higher, the pressure at the same depth will also be higher.

questions.question_text: Atmospheric pressure decreases as we go higher above sea level.
questions.explanation_correct: Atmospheric pressure decreases as we go higher above sea level because there is less air (fewer air molecules) exerting pressure on us. At sea level, the atmosphere is thicker and exerts more pressure, but as we go higher up, the atmosphere becomes thinner and the pressure decreases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be that atmospheric pressure increases as we go higher above sea level. This is a common misconception because people think the higher you go, the more air there is and the greater the pressure. However, the reality is that the higher you go, the less air there is above you, so the pressure decreases.

questions.question_text: Hydraulic brakes in vehicles work on the principle of Pascal's law.
questions.explanation_correct: Hydraulic brakes in vehicles do work on the principle of Pascal's law. This law states that pressure applied to a confined fluid is transmitted equally in all directions. In a hydraulic brake system, when the driver presses the brake pedal, it applies force to the brake fluid, which then transmits this pressure equally to all parts of the brake system, causing the brake pads to grip the wheels and stop the vehicle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement that hydraulic brakes in vehicles do not work on the principle of Pascal's law is incorrect. Hydraulic brakes use a fluid (brake fluid) that is confined in a closed system. When the driver presses the brake pedal, it applies force to this fluid, which then transmits the pressure equally in all directions, as per Pascal's law, causing the brake pads to grip the wheels and stop the vehicle.

questions.question_text: Pressure equals force divided by ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'area' because the formula for pressure is Pressure = Force / Area. Pressure is the force acting on a surface divided by the area of that surface. So, to find the pressure, you need to divide the force by the area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'area'. The incorrect answer would be something like 'mass' or 'volume'. However, pressure is not defined as force divided by mass or volume. Pressure is specifically the force divided by the area of the surface it is acting on.

questions.question_text: The SI unit of pressure is ___, which equals 1 N/m².
questions.explanation_correct: The SI unit of pressure is the Pascal (Pa), which equals 1 Newton per square meter (1 N/m²). This is because pressure is defined as the force (thrust) acting on a surface, divided by the area of that surface. Therefore, the unit of pressure is the unit of force (N) divided by the unit of area (m²).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Pascal (Pa). The SI unit of pressure is not just any random unit, but specifically the Pascal, which equals 1 N/m². This is because pressure is defined as the force (thrust) acting on a surface, divided by the area of that surface. Therefore, the unit of pressure must be the unit of force (N) divided by the unit of area (m²).

questions.question_text: The formula for liquid pressure at depth h is P = ρg___.
questions.explanation_correct: The formula for liquid pressure at depth h is P = ρgh, where ρ is the density of the liquid, g is the acceleration due to gravity, and h is the depth of the liquid. This is because the pressure in a liquid increases with the depth, as the weight of the liquid above exerts more force per unit area on the surface below.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The formula is actually P = ρgh, not P = ρg. The 'h' in the formula represents the depth of the liquid, not some other variable. The pressure in a liquid increases with the depth because of the increasing weight of the liquid above pushing down on the surface below.

questions.question_text: A ___ is used to measure atmospheric pressure and was invented by Torricelli.
questions.explanation_correct: A barometer is used to measure atmospheric pressure, which is the pressure exerted by the air around us. The barometer was invented by Torricelli, an Italian scientist, to measure this air pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'barometer'. A barometer is an instrument used to measure atmospheric pressure, which is the pressure of the air around us. It was invented by Torricelli, an Italian scientist, to measure this air pressure. Other instruments, such as a thermometer or a hygrometer, are used to measure temperature or humidity, respectively, but not atmospheric pressure.

questions.question_text: Arrange these depths in order of increasing water pressure:
questions.explanation_correct: The pressure in water increases with depth. Therefore, the pressure at the surface is the lowest, followed by the pressure at 10 m depth, and the pressure is highest at 50 m depth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order of increasing water pressure is not surface, 10 m deep, 50 m deep. This is because the pressure in water increases with depth. The pressure at the surface is the lowest, followed by the pressure at 10 m depth, and the pressure is highest at 50 m depth.

questions.question_text: Arrange these in order of increasing pressure (same force applied):
questions.explanation_correct: The snowshoe has the largest surface area, so the same force applied to it will result in the lowest pressure. The stiletto heel has the smallest surface area, so the same force applied to it will result in the highest pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order of increasing pressure is incorrect. The stiletto heel has the smallest surface area, so the same force applied to it will result in the highest pressure. The flat shoe has a larger surface area, so the same force applied to it will result in lower pressure than the stiletto heel. The snowshoe has the largest surface area, so the same force applied to it will result in the lowest pressure.

questions.question_text: 1 Pascal is equal to:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 1 N/m². This is because the SI unit of pressure is the Pascal (Pa), and 1 Pa is defined as 1 Newton per square meter (1 N/m²).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect. Option A) 1 N/cm² is not the correct SI unit for pressure, as the area is in square centimeters instead of square meters. Option C) 1 kg/m² is a unit of density, not pressure. Option D) 1 N·m is a unit of torque, not pressure.

questions.question_text: Thrust is a:
questions.explanation_correct: Thrust is a vector quantity because it has both magnitude (size) and direction. It is a force acting on a surface, which is a vector quantity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Thrust is not a scalar quantity because it has a direction, not just a magnitude or size. It is also not 'neither' a scalar nor a vector quantity, as thrust is clearly a vector quantity. Thrust is not both a scalar and vector quantity, as these are mutually exclusive categories for a physical quantity.

questions.question_text: If the same force is applied over a larger area, the pressure will:
questions.explanation_correct: If the same force is applied over a larger area, the pressure will decrease. This is because pressure is defined as the force per unit area, so as the area increases while the force remains the same, the pressure will decrease.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure will decrease if the same force is applied over a larger area. This is because pressure is calculated by dividing the force by the area. If the force remains the same but the area increases, the pressure will become smaller. Option A, C, and D are incorrect because the pressure will not increase, remain the same, or become zero in this scenario.

questions.question_text: Liquid pressure at a point depends on:
questions.explanation_correct: Liquid pressure at a point depends on both the depth of the liquid and its density. This is given by the formula P = ρgh, where P is pressure, ρ is the density of the liquid, g is the acceleration due to gravity, and h is the depth of the liquid. The depth and density both affect the pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Liquid pressure at a point does not depend on the shape of the container. The pressure depends only on the depth of the liquid and its density, as given by the formula P = ρgh. The shape of the container does not affect the pressure at a particular point within the liquid.

questions.question_text: Standard atmospheric pressure at sea level is approximately:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 101,325 Pa. Standard atmospheric pressure at sea level is approximately 101,325 pascals, which is the average pressure exerted by the Earth's atmosphere at sea level.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect. Option A) 76 Pa is too low, as standard atmospheric pressure is much higher. Option B) 1,000 Pa is also too low. Option D) 10 Pa is much too low and does not represent the actual standard atmospheric pressure at sea level.

questions.question_text: Why do camels have broad feet?

options.text: To reduce pressure on sand and not sink

questions.explanation_correct: Camels have broad feet to reduce the pressure they exert on the sand, which prevents them from sinking. Spreading the force (weight) over a larger area decreases the pressure, allowing camels to walk across the desert without sinking into the sand.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Camels do not have broad feet to walk faster, look bigger, or increase pressure. Their wide feet distribute their weight over a larger area, reducing the pressure they exert and allowing them to easily move across the soft desert sand without sinking.

questions.question_text: A box exerts 200 Pa pressure on the floor. If the same box is placed on its smaller face, the pressure:
questions.explanation_correct: The pressure exerted by the box on the floor is the force (weight of the box) divided by the area of the floor it is in contact with. When the box is placed on its smaller face, the area of contact with the floor decreases, so the pressure increases according to the formula Pressure = Force / Area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure does not decrease or remain the same when the box is placed on its smaller face. This is because the weight of the box (the force) remains the same, but the area of contact with the floor decreases. According to the formula Pressure = Force / Area, a smaller area will result in a higher pressure.

questions.question_text: In a hydraulic press, if the input area is 10 cm² and output area is 100 cm², a force of 10 N at input produces output force of:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 100 N. This is because in a hydraulic press, the output force is proportional to the input force, and inversely proportional to the input and output areas. Since the input area is 10 cm² and the output area is 100 cm², the output force will be 10 times the input force, which is 100 N.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not account for the relationship between the input and output areas of the hydraulic press. Option A) 1 N is too small, as the output force should be 10 times the input force. Option B) 10 N is also incorrect, as the output force should be 100 N. Option D) 1000 N is too large, as the output force should be 10 times the input force, which is 100 N.

questions.question_text: Water pressure at 10 m depth is: (Take g = 10 m/s², density of water = 1000 kg/m³)
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 100000 Pa. This is because the pressure in a liquid increases with depth, and the formula for pressure in a liquid is P = ρgh, where ρ is the density of the liquid, g is the acceleration due to gravity, and h is the depth. Plugging in the values given, we get P = 1000 kg/m³ × 10 m/s² × 10 m = 100000 Pa.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not accurately calculate the pressure at a depth of 10 meters. Option A) 10000 Pa is too low, option C) 1000 Pa is too low, and option D) 100 Pa is much too low. The correct formula to use is P = ρgh, which gives the pressure as 100000 Pa at a depth of 10 meters.

questions.question_text: Why does your ear pain when you dive deep into a swimming pool?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) Water pressure increases with depth. When you dive deep into a swimming pool, the water pressure increases with the depth. This is because the weight of the water above you pushes down on your eardrums, causing them to feel the increased pressure and making your ears hurt.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because: A) Water entering your ear is not the reason for the ear pain, it is the increased water pressure. C) Temperature changes would not cause ear pain in a swimming pool. D) Chlorine in the water is not the reason for the ear pain, it is the increased water pressure at greater depths.

questions.question_text: A force of 500 N acts on an area of 0.5 m². The pressure is:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 1000 Pa. This is because the formula for pressure is Pressure = Force / Area. With a force of 500 N acting on an area of 0.5 m², the pressure can be calculated as 500 N / 0.5 m² = 1000 Pa.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not match the result obtained from the pressure formula. Option A) 250 Pa is too low, option C) 500 Pa is half the correct value, and option D) 100 Pa is too low. The correct answer is B) 1000 Pa, which is the result of applying the pressure formula correctly.

questions.question_text: Which of the following uses Pascal's law?
questions.explanation_correct: The hydraulic lift uses Pascal's law, which states that pressure applied to a confined fluid is transmitted equally in all directions. This principle allows the hydraulic lift to amplify small forces applied to the piston to lift heavy loads.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The lever, pulley, and inclined plane are examples of simple machines that use the principles of mechanical advantage, not Pascal's law. Pascal's law applies to confined fluids, where a force applied to one part of the fluid is transmitted equally to all other parts of the fluid.

questions.question_text: A mercury barometer shows 76 cm at sea level. At a mountain top, it shows 70 cm. This means:

options.text: Atmospheric pressure is higher at the mountain top
Atmospheric pressure is lower at the mountain top

questions.explanation_correct: The atmospheric pressure at the mountain top is lower than at sea level. Since the mercury barometer shows a lower height (70 cm) at the mountain top compared to 76 cm at sea level, this means the atmospheric pressure is lower at the mountain top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The atmospheric pressure is lower at the mountain top because as you go higher in altitude, there is less air (and air molecules) above you, so the pressure exerted by the air is lower. Option A, where the pressure is higher at the mountain top, is incorrect because the barometer reading shows a lower pressure at the higher altitude.

questions.question_text: Pressure at the same depth in a liquid is:
questions.explanation_correct: The pressure in a liquid is the same in all directions at the same depth. This is because the liquid exerts force equally in all directions, as per Pascal's law.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure at the same depth in a liquid is not different in different directions, nor is it only upward or downward. The pressure is the same in all directions because the liquid transmits the force equally in all directions, as stated by Pascal's law.

questions.question_text: If both force and area are doubled, the pressure:
questions.explanation_correct: If both the force and the area are doubled, the pressure remains the same. This is because pressure is defined as the force per unit area, and when both the force and the area are doubled, the ratio of the two (which is the pressure) remains the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because pressure is not affected by changes in both force and area. When both force and area are doubled, the pressure remains the same, as the ratio of force to area does not change. The pressure only changes if either the force or the area changes, but not when they both change by the same amount.

questions.question_text: Water flows from a tap because of:
questions.explanation_correct: Water flows from a tap because of the water pressure in the tank or pipe. The pressure in the tank or pipe, created by the weight of the water, pushes the water out through the tap.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B, water pressure in the tank. Water does not flow from a tap solely due to gravity (option A) or atmospheric pressure (option C) - there needs to be enough pressure in the water system to push the water out. An electric pump (option D) is not required for a basic water tap, as the pressure from the tank or pipe is sufficient to make the water flow.

questions.question_text: The Torricelli barometer uses:
questions.explanation_correct: The Torricelli barometer uses mercury because mercury is a dense liquid that can be used to measure atmospheric pressure. The weight of the mercury column in the Torricelli barometer balances the weight of the atmospheric air, allowing the pressure to be measured accurately.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Torricelli barometer does not use water, alcohol, or oil because these liquids are not dense enough to be used effectively in a barometer. Mercury is the ideal liquid for a Torricelli barometer because it is 13.6 times denser than water, allowing it to be used to measure atmospheric pressure accurately.

questions.question_text: Nails have pointed tips to:
questions.explanation_correct: Nails have pointed tips to increase the pressure and allow them to easily penetrate the surface. Pressure is defined as force per unit area, so a smaller area (pointed tip) will result in a higher pressure, making it easier for the nail to go through the material.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the main reasons for nails having pointed tips. Reducing the force is not the goal, as the pointed tip actually increases the pressure. The sharp look is a secondary feature, not the primary purpose. Saving metal is also not the main reason for the pointed design.

questions.question_text: Liquid pressure does not depend on:
questions.explanation_correct: The shape of the container does not affect the pressure of a liquid. This is because pressure in a liquid depends only on the depth of the liquid and the density of the liquid, not the shape of the container it is in.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Liquid pressure does depend on the depth of the liquid, the density of the liquid, and the acceleration due to gravity. The formula for liquid pressure is P = ρgh, where ρ is the density of the liquid, g is the acceleration due to gravity, and h is the depth of the liquid. The shape of the container does not affect the pressure in the liquid.

questions.question_text: The unit of thrust is:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) Newton. Thrust is a force, and the SI unit of force is the Newton (N). Pressure, on the other hand, is the force per unit area, with the unit of Pascal (Pa).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not the correct units for thrust. Option A) Pascal is the unit of pressure, not thrust. Option C) Joule is the unit of energy, and option D) Watt is the unit of power. Thrust is a force, and the SI unit for force is the Newton (N).

questions.question_text: Pressure is a scalar quantity.
questions.explanation_correct: Pressure is a scalar quantity because it has only a magnitude (value) and no direction. The formula for pressure, P = F/A, shows that pressure is the force acting perpendicular to a surface divided by the area of that surface. Since force and area are both scalar quantities, the resulting pressure is also a scalar quantity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pressure is not a vector quantity. A vector quantity has both magnitude (value) and direction, like force or velocity. Pressure is the measure of force per unit area, which is a scalar property that only has a magnitude. The formula for pressure, P = F/A, shows that it is a scalar value and does not involve any direction.

questions.question_text: Liquid pressure at the same depth is the same regardless of container shape.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is true because pressure in a liquid depends only on the depth, not the shape of the container. This is due to Pascal's law, which states that pressure applied to a confined liquid is transmitted equally in all directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is not true. Even though the depth of the liquid may be the same, the pressure can vary depending on the shape of the container. This is because the pressure in a liquid is calculated using the formula P = ρgh, where ρ is the density of the liquid, g is the acceleration due to gravity, and h is the depth of the liquid. The shape of the container does not affect this formula.

questions.question_text: A suction cup works because of atmospheric pressure.
questions.explanation_correct: A suction cup works because of atmospheric pressure. When the suction cup is pressed against a surface, the air inside the cup is pushed out, creating a vacuum. The higher atmospheric pressure outside the cup then pushes the cup tightly against the surface, creating a strong grip.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A suction cup does not work due to gravity or the weight of the object. It works because of the difference in atmospheric pressure. When the suction cup is pressed against a surface, the air inside the cup is pushed out, creating a vacuum. The higher atmospheric pressure outside the cup then pushes the cup tightly against the surface, creating a strong grip.

questions.question_text: In a hydraulic system, pressure is multiplied.
questions.explanation_correct: In a hydraulic system, pressure is not multiplied. According to Pascal's law, pressure applied to a confined fluid is transmitted equally in all directions without any increase or decrease. The force is multiplied, but the pressure remains the same throughout the system.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false because pressure is not multiplied in a hydraulic system. Pressure is defined as the force per unit area, and it is transmitted equally in all directions in a confined fluid, as stated by Pascal's law. The force may be multiplied, but the pressure itself does not change.

questions.question_text: Tractors have broad tyres to reduce pressure on soft ground.
questions.explanation_correct: Tractors have broad tyres to reduce the pressure on soft ground. The pressure is equal to the force (weight of the tractor) divided by the area of the tyre in contact with the ground. By having broader tyres, the area in contact with the ground increases, which reduces the pressure on the soft ground and prevents the tractor from sinking.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Tractors have broad tyres to reduce the pressure on soft ground. If the tractor had narrow tyres, the pressure on the ground would be higher, causing the tractor to sink into the soft soil. Broad tyres distribute the weight of the tractor over a larger area, reducing the pressure and allowing the tractor to move more easily on soft surfaces.

questions.question_text: Atmospheric pressure acts only in the downward direction.
questions.explanation_correct: Atmospheric pressure acts in all directions, not just downward. The air around us exerts pressure in all directions, including upward, sideways, and downward. This is because the air molecules are moving in all directions and colliding with the surfaces around them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Atmospheric pressure is the force exerted by the weight of the air above us. However, this pressure is not just in the downward direction. The air molecules are moving in all directions and colliding with surfaces in all directions, so the pressure is transmitted equally in all directions, not just downward.

questions.question_text: ___ is the force acting perpendicular to a surface.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is correct because thrust is the force that acts perpendicular to a surface. Pressure is defined as the force (thrust) per unit area, so thrust is the force component that creates pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer is 'Thrust', not 'Pressure'. Pressure is the force per unit area, but thrust is the force that acts perpendicular to the surface. Thrust is the correct term to use here, as it is the force component that creates the pressure.

questions.question_text: Pascal's law states that pressure is transmitted ___ in all directions.
questions.explanation_correct: Pascal's law states that pressure applied to a confined fluid is transmitted equally in all directions. This means the pressure is spread out evenly throughout the fluid, not just in one direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'equally'. Pascal's law states that pressure applied to a confined fluid is transmitted equally in all directions. This means the pressure is spread out evenly throughout the fluid, not just concentrated in one area. The wrong answer would be if the pressure was only transmitted in some directions and not others, which is not what Pascal's law describes.

questions.question_text: Standard atmospheric pressure is equal to 76 cm of ___ column.
questions.explanation_correct: The standard atmospheric pressure is measured using a barometer, which measures the pressure exerted by the column of mercury (Hg) in the barometer. This is because mercury is a dense liquid, and the height of the mercury column is proportional to the atmospheric pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The standard atmospheric pressure is not measured using a column of water. Instead, it is measured using a barometer that measures the height of a column of mercury (Hg). This is because mercury is a very dense liquid, and the height of the mercury column is directly proportional to the atmospheric pressure. The correct answer is 'mercury', not 'water'.

questions.question_text: Hydraulic machines work on ___ law.
questions.explanation_correct: Hydraulic machines like hydraulic presses and hydraulic lifts work on the principle of Pascal's law. According to this law, when pressure is applied to a confined fluid, it is transmitted equally in all directions. This allows hydraulic machines to amplify small forces into much larger forces, making them very useful.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Pascal's law'. Hydraulic machines work by using the properties of fluids, and specifically the principle that pressure is transmitted equally in all directions, as described by Pascal's law. This allows them to amplify small forces into much larger forces, which is the key to their usefulness.

questions.question_text: For the same force, pressure is inversely proportional to ___.
questions.explanation_correct: For the same force, the pressure is inversely proportional to the area because the formula for pressure is Pressure = Force / Area. This means that as the area increases, the pressure decreases, and vice versa.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'area'. The formula for pressure is Pressure = Force / Area. This means that for the same force, if the area increases, the pressure will decrease. So the blank should be filled with 'area' to make the statement correct.

questions.question_text: Liquid pressure at depth h is given by the formula P = ___ × g × h.
questions.explanation_correct: The formula for liquid pressure at depth h is P = ρgh, where ρ represents the density of the liquid. This is because the pressure in a liquid increases with the depth, and the density of the liquid determines how much the pressure increases per unit of depth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is ρ, which represents the density of the liquid. The formula for liquid pressure at depth h is P = ρgh, where g is the acceleration due to gravity and h is the depth. Density is an important factor in determining the pressure in a liquid, as it affects how much the pressure increases with depth.

questions.question_text: An ___ barometer does not use liquid and uses a metal box instead.
questions.explanation_correct: An aneroid barometer uses a metal box with a flexible diaphragm instead of liquid to measure atmospheric pressure. This allows the barometer to be more compact and portable compared to the traditional mercury barometer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'aneroid'. An aneroid barometer does not use liquid like a mercury barometer. Instead, it uses a metal box with a flexible diaphragm to measure changes in atmospheric pressure. This makes the aneroid barometer more compact and easier to use than a liquid-based barometer.

questions.question_text: 1 atmosphere = 101325 ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is Pa (Pascal) because 1 atmosphere is a unit of pressure, and the SI unit of pressure is the Pascal. 1 Pa is equal to 1 N/m², so 1 atmosphere is equivalent to 101,325 Pa.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be something like 'kPa' (kilopascals) or 'hPa' (hectopascals). These are not the correct units for 1 atmosphere, which is specifically equal to 101,325 Pascals. Pressure is measured in Pascals, so the correct answer is simply 'Pa'.

questions.question_text: Arrange liquids in order of pressure at the same depth (least to most):
questions.explanation_correct: The order of pressure at the same depth is determined by the density of the liquid. Mercury has the highest density, so it will experience the greatest pressure at a given depth. Water has a lower density than mercury, so it will experience less pressure. Oil has the lowest density, so it will experience the least pressure at the same depth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to arrange the liquids from least to most pressure as: Water, Oil, Mercury. This is incorrect because mercury has a higher density than water and oil, so it will experience the greatest pressure at the same depth. Water has a higher density than oil, so it will experience more pressure than oil at the same depth.

questions.question_text: Arrange in order of increasing atmospheric pressure:
questions.explanation_correct: The atmospheric pressure is highest at the top of a mountain, lower at sea level, and lowest at the bottom of a mine. This is because the atmospheric pressure decreases as you go higher in altitude, and increases as you go deeper underground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Sea level, Top of mountain, Bottom of a mine. This is because the atmospheric pressure is generally higher at sea level compared to the top of a mountain, and it increases as you go deeper underground. The atmospheric pressure is affected by the weight of the air above the measurement point, which decreases with increasing altitude and increases with increasing depth.

questions.question_text: Arrange steps in how a hydraulic brake works:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: 1) Driver presses the brake pedal, 2) Pressure is transmitted through the brake fluid, and 3) The brake pads press against the wheel. This is because when the driver presses the pedal, it creates pressure in the fluid, which then pushes the brake pads against the wheel to slow down the vehicle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: 1) Brake pads press against the wheel, 2) Driver presses the brake pedal, 3) Pressure is transmitted through the brake fluid. This is wrong because the pressure in the brake fluid is created when the driver presses the pedal, and this pressure is then transmitted to the brake pads to make them press against the wheel.

questions.question_text: Arrange in order of increasing pressure exerted on ground (same person):
questions.explanation_correct: The pressure exerted on the ground is lowest when you are lying down because your body weight is distributed over a larger area. When standing on both feet, the pressure is higher as the same weight is distributed over a smaller area. The pressure is highest when standing on one foot, as the weight is concentrated on an even smaller area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure is not highest when standing on one foot. This is because even though the area in contact with the ground is smaller, the force (your body weight) remains the same. So, the pressure will be higher when standing on both feet compared to standing on one foot, since the weight is distributed over a larger area. The lowest pressure is when you are lying down, as your body weight is distributed over the largest area.
